Reviews.Title: Great to Carry Around
Reviews.Author: Karen S. Garvin
Reviews.Content: I just bought this camera two days ago from a camera store (yes, of course it's cheaper here). I have four other cameras, two film (Nikons) and two digital (one Nikon and one Olympus), but I wanted something that I could fit in my purse or backpack. Many times I want to take pictures, but am too lazy to carry my camera gear unless I'm planning a photo outing. This camera literally fits into my jeans pocket so I will be able to carry it every day.So far I find the camera's menu systems are similar to the menu on my other Nikon cameras (N80, D70). This makes the learning curve easier. When you turn the camera off, the lens collapses into the body of the camera, and there is a lens cover that closes over the lens to protect it. That isn't shown in the photograph.I like that the camera allows you to turn off the flash if you don't want it on. I like to do natural light photography; sometimes I don't want the flash. Too many point-and-shoots try to think for the photographer and "fix" everything for you, but sometimes you want to do silly things when you're doing experimental art! The camera has several white balance options, as well as monochrome, sepia, and cyanotype (blue). The photographer has the option of using these or adjusting the settings manually.There is a good user manual with the camera. I found it easy to find things in the table of contents, or the index. Instructions are pretty straightforward so you can go to the section you want without having to read the whole chapter.

Reviews.Title: Nice point and shoot for price, but has drawbacks
Reviews.Author: DEva
Reviews.Content: This is the first time that I bought something new on the market. Typically, I buy something after it has been reviewed for at least 6 months, but I had to replace the "family point and shoot" before Easter.  I was replacing my old Nikon Coolpix 5900 (which was a little bulky, but took FANTASTIC photos).  I also loved the video quality.  I stayed with the Nikon family because it is what I know, and I just am not ready to pay so much for the Canon lines (and I don't like the photo quality - can't explain, but I like my Nikon better).I got the camera 2 weeks ago, and so far I have found:1) That it is incredibly small - which is good and bad.  It can go anywhere, but holding it makes you kind of nervous, like you could drop it easily.2)The large viewscreen is large, and I am very worried that I may drop it and shatter it easily.  The camera itself is very smooth, and feels "slippery" in your hands.3) The one complaint that I know I even had with my old Nikon - shutter/recovery time is slow with this camera - you can't just "click" away. This is not so nice when you have fidgety children, and you want to capture a moment.4) The scene/mode setup has slightly changed for me, and to get to a different "mode", you can't just turn the dial, like I did on the old 5900, you have to push a few more buttons.  This will be tedious when you are moving from different environments, and want to alter the settings.5) The biggest complaint I have is that this camera is has a very sensitive at autofocusing, and based on what I have seen so far, it will not take pictures closeup unless you actually set it at the macro mode.I don't think I will return it because I have found that unfortunately, these new digital cameras don't seem to last, and I won't invest over $200 for a point and shoot.  This is good for quick shots when you are out on the go, and can fit in your back pocket. For the better photos, I use my D80 (it is a dream).4/4/08 UPDATE - I have used the camera a little more. I have noted that:1) to get the shots to come out, you really have to become quite knowledgeable with how to adjust your settings (exposure compensation, mode, light source, white balance, etc.)  READ THE MANUAL, and PRACTICE.  Once you figure that out, your pictures are fine. This does get a little tedius when you are trying to capture that moment with fidgeting subjects (i.e. children & animals).2) Also, the movies are not MPG's anymore they are now in the AVI format.  They still turn out fine, and the mic is SUPERSENSITIVE3) The latch for the battery compartment is still the same - this worries me because this is what failed on my 5900, (and my mom's Canon).  Once that went out, (and we went on vacation), the camera was never the same (i.e. beach air, sand, AC - you do the math).  You would think they would fix this problem, but I am seeing it with not just one line, but others as well.4)  I am not a real fan of the way you switch from regular camera, to a specific scene (i.e. indoors, niteshots, etc), to movie mode.  You have to push a MODE button, scroll, and then push OK.  The buttons on the back are the same as my old 5900, just a little smaller (men with big fingers could get annoyed easily).5)  The on/off button is TINY and is right in next to the button that you use to take the photos/and take videos (at the top of the camera).  Honestly, I confuse them at times, and will turn the camera off when I want to begin a video.All in all,If I could do all over again, I wouldn't go ultracompact and would go more compact.  It serves it's purpose, but remember - you are getting what you paid for.UPDATE 1/9/09:  By September 08, I had to get another camera because this one decided to break down on my family vacation - I am TRULY not a fan of this camera (the Lens just decided to not open and close).  I will just give it to my 4 yr old, and let her play with it.  I gambled and got the waterproof Pentax, and so far, I am pleased (not elated, but will be satisfied for now).

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix S210 8mp
Reviews.Author: James
Reviews.Content: Turns on very fastVery compact, excellent to take anywhereNice strap to fit around your hand, very easy to pull it out of your pocket and turn it on all with one hand safely, while your holding other things in your other handBattery seems to last forever enough for so many many pictures a dayGreat quality picturesEasy uploading to computer, software easy to install.

Reviews.Title: Great Beginner Compact
Reviews.Author: Kelly from GA "kellybethga"
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my daughter's 5-year-old birthday (some of you may call me crazy, but I'm looking forward to a "year in pictures from a 5-year-old's perspective".  I wanted nice picture quality with, and this is paramount, great shutter response.  This camera is very fast, so my daughter doesn't get frustrated thinking she hasn't gotten the shot.  The LCD screen is nice, big and bright.  It's super easy to use - she already knows how to zoom in and out and review pictures (you can go back to picture-taking mode just by pressing the shutter button halfway).  I've been comparing pictures to my Canon SD800 IS and these pictures are as good or better.  The colors are very accurate (also a big consideration for me - my fair skinned family can easily look blue or red with the wrong color balance) and pictures are, while not as sharp as high-end cameras, sharp enough for regular prints.  I think Nikon may be finally putting in some competitive cameras in the compact market.As well - the camera seems very durable, it's made of metal/  A lot of lower-end cameras are plastic.  It's already stood up to her slinging it around by the strap into the wall with no trouble (well, not to the camera, but to her there was).

Reviews.Title: Great little camera for the price.
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I was going on a cross-country trip and was looking for a digital camera to bring with me when my mom recommended this one. I'd never owned a digital camera before, so I was looking for one with a reasonable price and not too many complicated features. This camera fits all my needs and more. Physically, it's a cute color (plum) and small enough to slip into your pocket if you're in a rush (as I was when I took it to the Celtics parade). The interface is pretty intuitive, and I personally prefer using a menu to switch modes over the standard wheel as I'm often worried about bumping said wheel by accident!As for the pictures it takes? They're not perfect, but they suit my purpose. Some people may want something with more megapixels, but 8 is enough for me. It sometimes has trouble focusing on the correct subject. It doesn't seem to have much of a problem with pet eye, though! Also, the video feature is a wonderful bonus, it picks up audio surprisingly well. Make sure to buy an SD card, though!A small worry I have is that the battery compartment door seems a little.. "loose." It's not going to pop open on its own, but it does wiggle a little bit and sand could probably get in if you took it to the beach. Buying a case for it would probably decrease that risk significantly, though.Overall, I feel this is a great digital camera for the price and makes a good starter digital camera for someone like me who isn't usually very good with them.

Reviews.Title: Good Buy, nothing more, nothing less
Reviews.Author: A. Espinoza
Reviews.Content: The camera is easy to use, love the color....but you get what you pay for. I wish I would have spent the extra $50 something for the added pixels and optical zoom on the S520. I get blurry pics and I don't see any image stabilization, it doesn't zoom very far, and the camera is really light-weight, so make sure you wear the wrist strap or the thing may go flying. Overall its a good deal, but if you don't plan on buying another camera anytime soon, fork out the extra cash for a better model.

Reviews.Title: I'm so happy!
Reviews.Author: H. Erickson-Sander "Heather"
Reviews.Content: What a great little camera for the price! I am so happy with my purchase. The camera is so easy to use (I can't stand cameras that make you go through 5 menus just to delete a picture) and user friendly. The quality of pictures is impressive for a camera this size and price. I would tell anyone who bought this camera, to read through the manual at what settings to turn on for different types of pictures. It tells you exactly how to take a picture of all sorts of views, like fireworks, people standing indoors in front of bright windows, etc. It helps a lot to know what to turn on/off for such scenes. Some of the complaints I've read in other reviews make me think that people aren't learning how to use settings properly.The color of the camera is nice, already gotten compliments on it. The view screen is a very good quality. One of the most important features to me is how fast it takes pictures. I also needed a camera that would take good up-close shots of the jewelry I make. The macro setting is perfect and the pictures turn out great. I'm very pleased. I would recommend this camera to anyone who wants great candids at family events/outings or a compact but well made camera for taking casual portrait-style pictures.

Reviews.Title: Well, it's portable.
Reviews.Author: FiveAgainst1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I purchased this as a complement to our Nikon D80 with the intent that she'd carry this small camera in her purse for candids.  All told, we're pleased with the size and speed of the camera but it really struggles to focus, has a difficult time handling either bright or low light, and takes pictures that I'd describe as "better than nothing".  We love our D80 and hoped just a bit of that Nikon know-how could be found here and are having a tough time to find it.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera / Wrong SD Card
Reviews.Author: A. S.
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera for general everyday use. The only problem I had was that I purchased this camera bundled with the recommended Kingston SD Card on Amazon's website. I was having trouble with the camera not saving the photos to the SD Card. I contacted Nikon's tech support and they informed me that only SanDisk, Lexar, Toshiba and Panasonic SD Cards are approved for use in this camera. I honestly don't see how that makes a difference but I will be trying a different card to see if that works.

Reviews.Title: Great pocket camera!
Reviews.Author: Facundo "Gaucho"
Reviews.Content: Turn it on and shoot a picture in just a second! Good quality pictures and great video!Life battery is one day and a couple of hours with intense use. The low battery sign will appear when you are already out there for another intense taking pictures day, so: get an extra battery or make sure every night you re-charge it. It takes about 1 1/2 hours to recharge it and the charger is light so you could event take it with you all the time.I has many picture options, try them to improve the picture quality.Very thin and light!Great display (may be the cause of low battery life...).Suggest at least 1GB memory card and a 2GB if you plan on making videos.

Reviews.Title: Warning: Do Not Buy!
Reviews.Author: Edward Sproul
Reviews.Content: I have owned Nikon cameras all my life because of their excellent quality so I felt no need to research this camera before I purchased.  Big mistake.  This camera has a reputation all over the internet (check for yourself) for something known as a "lens error".  The lens housing is very sensitive to sand or other debris that are part of the normal operating environment of a compact camera.  As soon as a bit of dust gets into the lens housing it jams and causes a lens error that renders the camera inoperable.  This problem cannot be fixed and since it is interpreted as "damaged" it is not covered under warranty.  In other words this camera has a short life span.  Give it a pass.

Reviews.Title: Nikon S-210
Reviews.Author: Lgantcha
Reviews.Content: This camera does a great job if you let it. Meaning just put it in automatic and select the stabalization to auto and let it go. The first pictures we took were using different settings and they did not turn out too good.Once we put everything in auto it worked out great! We even blew up a shot on the beach to an 8 by 10 and the detail was perfect!

Reviews.Title: Beware: Lens is JUNK.
Reviews.Author: K. Realmuto
Reviews.Content: After owning the camera for less than 8 weeks, I got a lens error just by turning it on.  The camera was never dropped or bumped and was kept in a case whenever not in use.  A bit of research showed that lens errors are not at all uncommon for this camera, so I must conclude that the lens has some sort of design flaw.  Nikon may make outstanding DSLRs, but this point and shoot appears to be junk.

Reviews.Title: NOT WORTH THE HASSLE! I WILL NEVER BUY NIKON AGAIN!
Reviews.Author: M. Kosmoski
Reviews.Content: I got my coolpix s210 in June. In August my camera displayed a LENS ERROR message and would no longer take pictures. I sent it to Nikon in September. They fixed it for free but I did not get it back until December. In less than a month it was BROKEN AGAIN! The monitor and all pictures have blue and red lines that run vertical straight through. I have to send it back once again AT MY OWN COST! This much hassle was not worth it! I purchased this camera to document my senior year in College... I have yet to have my camera for any of it!I will never buy a Nikon again!

Reviews.Title: Great camera.........almost.
Reviews.Author: S. A. K.
Reviews.Content: I got this camera for my birthday because I needed a small, take-anywhere camera. My primary camera is a Canon S3 IS, which is amazing, but bulky enough to be cumbersome on family outings. The S210 is tiny, cute (got the plum), and good enough for the most part. The only major negative for me is the zoom. The optical zoom causes noise when extended all the way and the digital zoom is just useless (they all are, though). Some of the settings are nice, like the back light setting. For what I got this camera for, it really does serve its purpose so I plan to hold on to it for some time. If I had it to do all over again, though, I'd have gone with the Canon SD1100 IS.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Marsha
Reviews.Content: I paid $179.00 for this at a local retail store and bought one on Amazon for $155.00 for my daughter, based on one reviewer who 'assured' me that all kids today take pictures every day and should just conveniently have their own. My daughter has the camera with her all the time, in her pocket, her purse, at school, on the bus, at a restaurant.  It does seem to be the newest, coolest little camera to take random shots and then download them onto her facebook.I, a non-techy, am impressed with the large screen, the ability to zoom, crop and review quickly, and the thin, lightweight frame. Mine came with a case, which I think is an essential if you are particular as I am about scratches and dropping accidents. The handle also proved important to me so as not to let it slip when taking a shot.The battery lasted throughout over 200 pictures on my last trip to Texas and the photos are detailed and rich in color, even ones taken in a cave! I recommend this little Nikon gem.

Reviews.Title: Much better than you think
Reviews.Author: johnd
Reviews.Content: Nikon Coolpix S210 8.0MP Digital Camera with 3x Optical Zoom (Graphite Black)I have only gotten a few pages into the manual and can only operate a few settings. Yet virtually every shot has come out good. 8"x10" prints from a color ink jet paper printer look great unless you really look close; just faint lines from the printer. Now THAT is a good camera and it would fit in a cigarette pack if you wished.I've used large, medium and 35mm formats and did my own developing and printing for a few decades. Grain? Very simple: film speed. 100 was ideal, 200 a touch of grain, 400 noticeable and so on. The higher the film speed, the more grain you get. Nothing is free, there is always a trade off. The more difficult you make it for a digital camera, the more problems with the photo.The best thing I ever did was take a photography class. Minimal cost, 4 or 5 evening classes, and I understood the trade offs between film speed, aperture and lens speed. I imagine digital has similar factors; if I was 100 miles closer to a city I would already be signed up.Don't expect miracles, but if you understand the basic principles you'll be able to handle tough conditions and get good pictures.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Miriam Smith "Miriam Carter~"
Reviews.Content: I love this camera, great price and the quality is awesome! The user face is super easy and not complex, figured it out in just a few minutes. I purchased one for my parents for Christmas, makes a great gift!

Reviews.Title: Wish I read these reviews
Reviews.Author: A. Drexler "aardvarkratnik"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my teenage son about 6 months ago.  He'd taken maybe 50 pictures with the thing when he started showing this "lens error".  We sent it in to Nikon for repair...warranty right?  Think again.  The "lens error" problem is considered damage and not covered.  So we got soaked for half the cost of a new camera.  Now looking at amazon I see a bunch of people warning of the same issue...wish I'd read it first.  Wish I'd bought a diferent camera

Reviews.Title: A Disappointing Nikon
Reviews.Author: Adolph Zitts
Reviews.Content: I bought the Nikon Coolpx S210 as a mother's day gift for my wife.  She wanted a small, simple, point-and-shoot camera.  The camera is indeed quite compact with some nice features, but in the end it is the quality of the photos that count.  Indoor/ flash photos were satisfactory, but outdoor pictures were uniformly flat and lacking in contrast. They even looked a bit out of focus. None of the various shooting modes was able to compensate for the poor outdoor picture quality.  I am an experienced photographer and computer user (I've owned seven Nikon film and digital cameras over the years).  I really expected more from Nikon, even at the low end of their line.  My wife also found the software that accompanied the camera difficult to understand and use to transfer her photos.  Editing software was not included.  This is not the Nikon quality I had been accustomed to for so many years.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Cat Lover
Reviews.Content: This is just what I was looking for! I wanted a Nikon that was small and thin enough to fit in my purse or pocket and this fits the bill. It has the features I wanted plus many more. I love the auto focus feature. It is also attractive; I have gotten many compliments on it. I definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: O.K. camera...until it broke.
Reviews.Author: Kimchi "Em"
Reviews.Content: I'll start by saying that this is my first camera review.  I'm also a big ol' noob (novice) when it comes to cameras, so please forgive my lack of concise terminology and limited experience with the camera's features.  That said, I suppose this review could be considered feedback from the general consumer.As the occasional and casual user, I was looking for a camera that would be compact, easy to use, would take great photos...basically a point-and-shoot camera for dummies.  The S210 actually packs a good bit of features into such a small camera and I found myself seduced by the price ($159 at the time of purchase), but I found myself getting lost in the multitudes of menus and settings.  I read most of the manual to try and familiarize myself with how this camera works and how best to use it, but many of the features were ones I probably would never use.I didn't care for the start-up.  It seems to take a bit longer than other cameras I've used, which made it a bit annoying when trying to catch a quick, random moment.  The power button is tiny and right next to the shutter button, so there were a few times when I meant to take a photo and ended up turning the camera off by accident.  I had a few choice words for myself and the camera in those instances.  Shutter speed also seemed a bit slow in comparison and I didn't like how unprotected the lens and its mechanisms were.  It would turn out I would have a good reason to worry.My husband and I took a trip to Playa del Carmen and when I took out the camera and turned it on, the lens only partially extended, retracted back into the camera and the screen said "Lens Error" and then promptly shut off.  I had used it a week prior to our vacation with no problems and when we traveled, I kept it in a hard case and carried it in my purse, so as not to crush or jumble it.  As anal retentive as I am, I can swear the camera stayed well protected and was not damaged during travel.  I also see that someone else has had the same problem.  After a few attempts of turning the camera on hoping whatever is stuck within the lens would correct itself, the cheap plastic pieces that make up the lens cover and the outer rim came loose and a sprinkling of plastic and tiny springs went falling to the floor.  I had had the camera less than 6 mos.I really wanted a camera while we were in Mexico, so we went to an office supply chain and I picked up a Fuji FinePix Z20fd.  I mainly chose it because the lens/shutter is protected by a door that slides open to turn the camera on.  After using the Fuji, it put things in perspective for me and I realized how much I didn't care for the Nikon.  The Fuji was more expensive, but it's much quicker in use and shutter speed, takes better photos with 10MP instead of 8MP, it seems/feels more substantial in the hand and seems to be better made all around.  Overall, I feel as though the S210 is trying to be a sophisticated little camera, but the cheap price meant they skimped on the materials.  I'm still feeling the burn of paying for a camera, only to have it break in less than 6 mos.

Reviews.Title: Not impressed at all
Reviews.Author: Annie Lou "A Smith"
Reviews.Content: I have taken this camera to concerts...pictures come out horrible. I even tried it on various settings (indoor, sports, nightscape, museum, firework, etc)...every single one came out blurry, distorted and really ruined the concert effect I was trying to save. I also tried zooming all the way, zoom 1/2 way and no zoom...all the images came out horrible. I am going back to Canon.

Reviews.Title: Lens error- good while it lasted
Reviews.Author: Rich
Reviews.Content: Like so many other buyers of this camera I got a lens error which rendered the camera useless. The camera was never dropped or bumped and was rarely used. I have owned Nikons all my life but the quality of this isn't up to their standards.

Reviews.Title: Waste of money
Reviews.Author: KAT
Reviews.Content: This camera was a nice size and a cute color and the battery lasts for a really long time. That is about where the positive attributes end. I had my heart set on another camera, but my fiance, a photographer, convinced me to go with Nikon because they put out very good quality products. I wasn't expecting D80 quality by any stretch of the imagination, but I would have expected my pictures to look decent. I read the manual cover to cover and played with the settings and still couldn't get my pictures to turn out not grainy and blurry. In the end, our dog went on a tear and used the camera as a chew toy, and that was probably for the best. I have since replaced it with a Polaroid t1234 (the camera that I had my heart set on in the beginning). It was much cheaper, has higher megapixels, is easier to use, and takes much better pictures.

Reviews.Title: Nikon coolpic
Reviews.Author: melanie locklear
Reviews.Content: The seller sent the item in a bag.  The camera only no charger or book with information on the camera.  It does not work and am having a hard time trying to find the power adapter for the item to charge it to see if it really works.  Was a gift for my daughters 10th birthday.  Do not recommended purchasing anything from this seller.  Not an honest person.  Stayed that the camera was new and in great condition.  I spent almost $100 dollars for it.  ***DO NOT PURCHASE FROM SELLER***

Reviews.Title: Don't Buy--Lens Error problems
Reviews.Author: C. Huggins
Reviews.Content: Do NOT buy this camera. It worked for less than a month for me. Then it had lens error issues. By that time, the 14-day warranty (that most vendors have) was up, and I was stuck with a bum camera. I've been researching online, and it seems that this has happened to lots of other people with the Nikon Coolpix S210 model. I would recommend a different camera and spare yourself the hassle.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: W. Fleming "Grandparents"
Reviews.Content: Takes great pictures and is simple to use. Small enough to fit in a purse or pocket easily but big enough to see whats in the view finder without glasses.

Reviews.Title: Pretty good camera.
Reviews.Author: Lau..
Reviews.Content: The s210 is a pretty good camera and I like it. Now i did take me some time to figure out how to use it properly...you may need to play with the settings for the pictures to come out clearly and with the right amount of light.Not using flash makes pictures blurry... I had this camera for 3 weeks and I like it... I just need to learn more about it :)

Reviews.Title: Nice little camera
Reviews.Author: Scott
Reviews.Content: Works great, but a memory card is a must. Only 30 ish shots stored internally.

Reviews.Title: An adorable, compact, easy-to-use, great camera!
Reviews.Author: Mikki58 "CeeBee"
Reviews.Content: This is an awesome camera! My Exilim broke, which was an excellent camera, but I wanted to try the Nikon family. This little camera, is really cute (plum colored), and it is extremely easy-to-use! It takes a really clear picture that look really life-like :-) The camera is comfortabke to hold, and it the zoom is okay... The video is pretty good for cameras like this. I havn't used the software it came with because it was compatible with the Kodak program I already had on my computer, so that worked out good! I would recomend it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: my nikon coolpix s210
Reviews.Author: katarina
Reviews.Content: i had wanted a digital camera FOREVER, until christmas 2008 when i FINALLY got one. it was plum, and i took it everywhere. i took amazing photos and i was actually asked to take photos at my grandmothers wedding. i have an eye for great photos, and this camera was perfect. in 2010, i was away from home and it got stolen :( so for christmas that year i got a new nikon, the coolpix L110. so far its been great. but the S210 was definitely the best camera ever. this is a great beginners camera, and i reccomend it to anyone who is just learning photoagraphy, and its also great for taking photos with friends and keeping in your back pocket. hence the name 'pocket camera'. if ur more advanced in photoagraphy, this wouldnt b the best camera, because its so simple. it was perfect for me, when i was new, but now i have moved on to a more advanced camera with a bigger, better, lens :)note: i get extremely pissd when ppl pointlessly put bad or unnessacery comments and ratings for good products. like on youtube, when they diss great singers. i understand that everyone is entitled to thier own opinion, but next time you comment on something, think if its negative or not, plz. im just a kid and i hate that kind of stuff.

Reviews.Title: Poor photo quality
Reviews.Author: Bruce Holmgreen "BDH"
Reviews.Content: This camera was sent back because the photos were very grainy at all settings. Hoping the new one works better.

Reviews.Title: 2 cameras, 2 "lens errors" = AVOID
Reviews.Author: J. Jones "Gadget Addict"
Reviews.Content: Title says it all,2 brand new S210's and both have been rendered useless due to "lens errors". Would avoid this model at all costs.

Reviews.Title: Fun camera!
Reviews.Author: J. Butler
Reviews.Content: This camera is ideal for someone like me... NOT tech-savvy!  Point & shoot, & get great pictures that are easy to download on to a computer.  However, once I read all the directions, I will be able to do much more than just point and click; this really is a versatile camera! I'm looking forward to enjoying it for a really long time.

Reviews.Title: Coolpix Is Cool
Reviews.Author: L. M. Walker
Reviews.Content: Nikon Coolpix S210 8MP Digital Camera with 3x Optical Zoom (Brushed Bronze)I've had my share of cameras and camcorders, and was quite amazed with the quality of this little gem.  Bought the Coolpix and Flip Mino for my husband as holiday gifts.  Both are excellent, so I purchased the same for myself.  The Coolpix is a combination of digital camera, camcorder, and voice recorder,and fits easily in my pocket.  EZ to use, EZ to download to your PC.

Reviews.Title: Just buy it already, you won't be sorry!!!
Reviews.Author: Michael K. Hestness
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a gift for someone on my list but after it was opened I found myself using it. This is a really nice little camera and takes very nice photo's for a point and shoot.My only complaint would be the delay between when you push the button and when it takes the pic, but as with any point and shoot you will get this delay so I'm not going to knock it.The bottom line is that you can't beat this little camera for the price.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Franz Galli
Reviews.Content: It's a great and compact camera. Takes great pictures, specially in outdoors. It takes pictures with great quality.

Reviews.Title: Nice small camera. Huge battery charger
Reviews.Author: John Beckett
Reviews.Content: I really like this tiny camera that now lives in my wife's purse. However the huge battery charger and plug-in cord that come with it are silly. Search for MH-63 charger on Amazon to see what I mean. The camera itself deserves 5 stars, but the big charger makes this a 3 star review. Nikon should learn from others and ship a small charger with pop out wall prongs. Better yet, charge the camera over USB like other small electronic devices so we don't have to remove the battery or memory card. If manufacturers of small electronics would consistently use USB, it would simplify packing for a trip and eliminate my box full of misc. chargers.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix S210
Reviews.Author: J. Husk "Roadster Rider"
Reviews.Content: Very nice camera. I bought this camera for a trip I'am taken on my motorcycle,it's small lightweight and takes super sharp pictures!!!!!!! I also sell things on ebay so the items I list will have pictures that are almost looking like they are already there. Guess thats why they call it Coolpix.  I personally recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Perhaps the perfect camera
Reviews.Author: svetlana
Reviews.Content: This is actually the second Coolpix S210 I have owned, the first one went with me everywhere but finally was done in by the super fine sand on Padre Island. These cameras simply take great pictures without even trying. Highly recommended. When my first one gave out I bought the 3100 and while it worked fine the pictures just wenen't as good. More pixels isnt always better.

Reviews.Title: Coolpix camera great !!
Reviews.Author: Millie
Reviews.Content: I've had this type of camera before, and was not hesitant to order it again.My daughter recommended it to me, and it's been great.

Reviews.Title: works nice
Reviews.Content: gave this as a present and it did was it was suppose to do.  Take quick pics when needed out of the purse.

Reviews.Title: Could be better
Reviews.Author: R. Hymanson "r u ruthless"
Reviews.Content: The color is cool.  The picture quality could be better; even for a point and shoot.  My other daughter's point and shoot operates better and has better picture quality.  This camera is better suited for younger kids where picture quality is not as important.

Reviews.Title: it is ok
Reviews.Author: helga
Reviews.Content: The first time I got it it didnit work for too long but then they sent me another one, it was very nice of them. It has been working good since then.

Reviews.Title: product is great. like this camera
Reviews.Author: Deanna Marz
Reviews.Content: great camera. takes good pics in light and dark. fast flash recharge. fast response (can take one pic after another on single pic mode with only about a 2 sec delay. also has multi-shot mode). too bad seller lied about its condition. buying used stuff from amazon has it's drawbacks but their guarantee makes it a little easier to deal with when someone tries to deceive you.

Reviews.Title: Piece of garbage and a complete waste of my money.
Reviews.Author: C. A. Wirfs "Buyer Extraordinaire"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my daughter who, while taking her 35mm photography class, could still enjoy taking digital photos with her friends and use when we go places.  She had it for only a few weeks before the infamous lens error issue crept up and rendered her camera useless.  It was a total waste of money and I wish I could have a do-over and NOT spend the money in the first place.

Reviews.Title: Coolpix P2 is much better
Reviews.Author: barbaija
Reviews.Content: The photos don't come out as clearly as when I take them on my NIkon Coolpix P2 & I'm not sure why.

Reviews.Title: It's ok since it's used.
Reviews.Author: Club man
Reviews.Content: Best result is to use it as an outdoors and to shoot landscapes.Tap the zoom in twice, that's the best shot you'll get. It's up to you to measure the distance.

Reviews.Title: Ok camera
Reviews.Author: Todd Matthews
Reviews.Content: This is a basic point and shoot camera.  I had a canon that seemed more durable.  Also, Ashton Kutcher is not cool.

Reviews.Title: Great low-budget quality camera
Reviews.Author: KC
Reviews.Content: Great pictures, great price. This was my first camera and it served me very well for 1 year before I upgraded.

Reviews.Title: AAHHHH-MAZING!
Reviews.Author: VAVA312
Reviews.Content: I AM EXTREMELY HAPPY WITH THIS CAMERA. I FEEL I DEFINITIVELY GOT MY MONEYS WORTH AND COULDNT ASK FOR MORE.I TAKE IT WITH ME EVERYWHERE AND CANT STOP CLICKING LOL. OVERALL I GIVE IT A 5 UT OF 5.

Reviews.Title: Picture Perfect!
Reviews.Author: T_B
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for almost a year now and still absolutely love it! I bought the refurbished one and have had no problems with it whatsoever.It's a durable little machine, surviving cross country road trips, vacations, freshman year of college, sandy beaches, poolside parties and everything in between!It's super easy to use and takes great photos. A lot of inexpensive cameras leave you with under or over exposed photos and bad coloring + saturation in the pictures, but this one has been very good at taking high quality pics.The macro mode isn't too sensitive, so closeups are not a very good option, but I'm talking extreme closeups. Usually the camera has pretty good focus, even without a flash.The shutter isn't super fast, but it still allows you to take good pictures.Over all, I would highly recommend this little camera as a perfect one for taking snaps at all your events!

Reviews.Title: Nikon S210
Reviews.Author: De Wilhelmsen
Reviews.Content: I have owned this camera since May 2008. I have had no problems and I have taken hundreds of photos, in the mountains, in desserts, and in the rain.  I have lent it out to others who needed a very small camera. I do not know how to use all the functions. It has a lot of them. I do know that you get much better pictures if you take a good look at what you're shooting, press the button half-way and let the camera read the scene before snapping in. You will see a little red box while it reads. It will retain the data for more shots that are taken in succession. This method is also true for my other digital, an Olympus that is much larger and cost four times as much (a good camera nevertheless). The S210 one is so tiny, it is always with me for that great shot that comes up unexpectedly. I bought it locally for the same price as Amazon and the place promised to stand behind it. I've never had a complaint. The price has actually come down since I got it.

Reviews.Title: Hit or miss, but mostly miss.......
Reviews.Author: Joe Jr.
Reviews.Content: I had this camera for about a year, after taking it on vacation and snapping more than 200 pictures I can honestly say that the quality of the photos are pretty bad. For some reason the pictures just look muted, dull, and take away from the color. Out of all of the photos I took, I can say that less then a quarter of them came out nice. Using this camera at night is out of the question, very grainy and blurry, even with the night function. It does have alot of different shooting functions, but just about each one was a failure. The size is nice, the price is good, and the video comes out ok, but as far as taking pictures, my old 5 mega pixel Kodak Easyshare blew this one out of the water.

Reviews.Title: Pink pictures
Reviews.Author: DScott
Reviews.Content: Camera worked fine for about a year.  Then the pictures started having a pinkish tint.  I went to a camera shop and was told that the sensor was defective.

Reviews.Title: nice for the price
Reviews.Author: Claudia
Reviews.Content: for the price i bought this camera i think i would be able to buy a canon or something... it is really cute and but night pictures not really good...

Reviews.Title: good while it lasts
Reviews.Author: marie a. rehman
Reviews.Content: i've had the nikon s210 for just over a year and it worked great, took good pictures and had awesome zoom capability. now i have the "lens error" problem that everyone else with this camera seems to have. i looked up all of the troubleshooting ideas online and after trying them, it still won't work. granted, i have been less than gentle with this camera and it still lasted me a year, but the lens issue seems to be a manufacturing problem that many people are complaining about.

Reviews.Title: Not great but ok for close up shots if your steady
Reviews.Author: Michelle Adams
Reviews.Content: Really touchy when it comes to light, movement and certain media cards. Sold it off and moved to a a480 and haven't been happier with a purse sized camera.

Reviews.Title: Not Worth It - Buy Something Else
Reviews.Author: Alex G. M.
Reviews.Content: I got this camera in December of 2008.  It worked great for five months - most pictures were great, video is so-so for one of these cameras, and not really good for nighttime shots (though it is a point-and-shoot).  But, five months after owning the camera, I turned it on and got a lens error.  It seems that has happened to most everyone who uses this camera.  It doesn't seem to matter how well you care for the camera, all of these Nikon S210s seem to get the lens error (I can't speak personally for other Nikon point-and-shoot or CoolPix models).  I sent my camera to Nikon and got the lens replaced under warranty.  They sent it back and about nine months later the exact same problem occurred and this time Nikon refused to fix it because it had been over six months.The LENS ERROR appears to be inevitable so don't even bother with this camera - it is definitely not worth the trouble or expense.  Nikon has good SLRs and that's what they should stick to.

Reviews.Title: Has spent more time in repair than with me
Reviews.Author: S. Yeates "JusticeforAll"
Reviews.Content: I had an older coolpix camera for years that I loved--this camera is HORRIBLE.  After 3 months it stopped working due to a "lens error."  Still under warranty, I sent it in for a repair.  It was gone a month, and when it came back, it still didn't work, this time saying "battery temperature high."  Sent it  in again.  Gone another month, even though I had a trip to China in two weeks and begged them to fix it sooner.  Gone another month, worked for two weeks, and same problem again.  Irate, asked for a new camera, they said no, could send it in again.  Worst experience ever.

Reviews.Title: digital camera
Reviews.Author: Donnese Barrington "sunny45"
Reviews.Content: I always carry two camera with me so when one of my cameras gave up the ghost, I decided on this one.  It is small but has really good qualities.  The picture is quite clear and it is easy to use.  Plus, once it is charged, it stays charged for a long time.  I would buy this item again.

Reviews.Title: Nikon warranty service stinks!!
Reviews.Author: R. W. Power
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my 16 yr old daughter for XMAS.  Worked great and took quality pics but after 6 months the lcd screen developed an internal crack.  Sent to Nikon and was told warranty wouldnt cover because it was dropped.There was not a scratch on the outside of the camera so I am sure it was not due to misuse.  Nikon wanted $99 to repair the camera. I feel their service after the sale is very poor.I have had great luck with Fuji cameras and am replacing this one with a Fuji.

Reviews.Title: Service Problem with COOLPIX
Reviews.Author: J. Eager
Reviews.Content: Just a word of caution for anyone considering buying the Coolpix digital camera. In my experience the camera will sometimes turn on in my pocket. Apparently, the On/Off switch is very sensitive and not well protected. Recently when it turned on, the lens opened up and a small amount of foreign matter got on the lens mechanism. My camera became inoperable with a "Lens Error" message displayed. My dealer said this problem happens frequently with the Coolpix. So my advice is be very careful with the lens mechanism or be prepared to have the camera serviced when this kind situation occurs.

Reviews.Title: Expensive Disposable Camera
Reviews.Author: annaneve
Reviews.Content: I was given this camera last Christmas. At first I was very pleased with because it's small and cute and purple. However, by May it had stopped working, got the LENS ERROR message that seems to happen to these cameras. When I turned the cameral on, the lens would come out and try to focus, then go back and close and display "lens error". Well I got it fixed and it came back and worked again...for about a month. Then the same thing happened and my only option is to get it repaired and risk this happening again, or get a new camera. So basically, this camera lasts for a few months and then is garbage. At store where it was purchased the customer service clerk told me "I have seen a lot of these come through with this problem". Bummer. I am getting a Sony I think.

Reviews.Title: Easier to toss your money in the trash!
Reviews.Author: Anne Schoenneman
Reviews.Content: Horrible camera from a company with a stellar reputation. LENS ERROR...not a question of if it will happen to your adorable camera, but WHEN it will happen. And no.....Nikon will not cover it. They will claim abuse and the cost to fix it is even more than the cost to purchase it, plus shipping! If you do get the notion to send it back to Nikon, any little mark on the camera, any scratch or even the tiniest loss of paint constitutes abuse and your warranty is voided. yikes!I bought 2 of these little unrecyclable monsters for my college age children and they each got under 6 months of use out of them. There is no way I would ever spend another dime with Nikon.

Reviews.Title: Blurry pictures, inconsistent
Reviews.Author: RomReader "Romance Book Reviews & Treats"
Reviews.Content: Very disappointed & frustrated with my Nikon coolpix 210. When images are still, the pictures look fine.  BUT pics taken where there's movement (i.e., children playing, people talking, waving), the pictures turn out very blurry & foggy! And it's inconsistent too.  I never knew when it would turn out well, even when I adjusted to Sports mode &/or added flash. I had to take several pics to make sure I get at least 1 ok/non-blurry shot.  SO FRUSTRATING!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Lens error
Reviews.Author: E. McCumber
Reviews.Content: The camera is compact and easy to use, but often the auto focus did not work properly, resulting in blurred photos.  Finally, after I'd had the camera a couple of months, the camera started having trouble when it was powered up.  The camera lens would not focus and eventually it'd give a "lens error" message on the viewfinder.  After a couple of tries it would usually work, but now it will not power up at all.  The "lens error" message shows up and it shuts itself off.  I've done some research and have found that this is a very common problem with the Nikon cameras.  Small particles of sand or lint will get into the camera lens extension and cause the camera to malfunction.  I will not buy another Nikon.

Reviews.Title: One problem
Reviews.Author: Vivian Keel "Smile!!"
Reviews.Content: I love this camera to tears!! Its stylish, compact, and has what seems like millions of different settings.  My only problem is the on/off button.  It is soo sensitive, it sometimes comes on without my noticing and runs he battery down. Other than that little problem, it is the best camera I have ever owned!!

Reviews.Title: Lens Error
Reviews.Author: j.f.b.
Reviews.Content: Do not buy this camera.  Read the other reviews dealing with "Lens Error."  Its not a question of if it will happen but when it will happen.

Reviews.Title: i love this camera!
Reviews.Author: munk "S. E. Torrence"
Reviews.Content: i love this camera!  this nikon is very user friendly.  i'm not much of a "tech-head" when it comes to gadgets, but this nikon coolpix proved me wrong.  the camera was very easy to us, and all the things that needed to be downloaded on the computer to develope the pictures was a snap!  i would highly recommed this camera to a beginner, or camera pro!

Reviews.Title: Love this camera
Reviews.Author: L. Thomson
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera for the type of people who want to capture memories of friends, special events ect. It takes great pictures and this is my second camera of this type. Its only drawback is that it takes a few seconds to capture a picture, which is not a problem unless you hope to take many action shots or fast consecutive pictures.Overall a good buy and I am happy with it.

Reviews.Title: Not a bad point and shoot
Reviews.Author: Mac the photographer "Lensman"
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my wife, to replace an Olympus that wasn't as small or as slick as this one.  I personally use DSLR's but I recognize the need for a pocket or purse camera.I have been disappointed by the Nikon point and shoots in the past.  They handle too slow, have a higher than average shutter lag, and the low light abilities are not that great.  That said, this time around I went to a local store and tried out all the newer models.  This one had the least start up time and shutter lag.  And it was the cheapest!  The lower megapixel count actually makes this a better camera compared to it's higher end brethren. There is less noise at higher ISO's as well, again compared to higher MP models.  Ashton Kutcher is a genius, lol!Easy decision. I got one for the wife.  It was easy enough for her to use with minimal instruction (who reads those manuals?). My wife's happy, I'm happy.  As a sidenote, I still prefer the discontinued Fuji F20, F30, F31fd models when it comes to point and shoots. That's how I roll.

Reviews.Title: nice camera
Reviews.Author: S. espinoza
Reviews.Content: the size of this camera makes it easy to carry around, it is small and thinner than your average point and shoot camera.  with 8mp, i have printed out super clear and colorful 8x10 pictures.  i am used to having rechargeable batteries because i can have a couple of sets always ready, but this camera uses the flat, cell phone type. i have only used it for special occasions, i have not yet put it to the test to see how long the battery life is.  the menu and featues are very easy to work and understand.  i have taken some videos and they are just ok, nothing to get excited about, it is just for fun, a 4 gig card will get you about 30 minutes of video only or over 800 pics on its highest resolution. a nice camera to have and play around with, i recommend it.

Reviews.Title: CoolPix
Reviews.Author: K Kumar
Reviews.Content: Nikon makes reputable products; I bought this for its price/performance. I bought 2 of these, one fell down and the lens got stuck, so I bought another one. No complaints.

Reviews.Title: Pleasantly surprise with the Nikon Coolpix S210
Reviews.Author: LFGD1978 "The Shopaholic"
Reviews.Content: To be honest with you I wasn't to hopeful about this $143 point and shot. But I purchase it anyway as a gift for my girlfriend, she got the ability to loose everything but the head over her shoulders, so I wasn't to exited about expending a lot of money on a camera that she will loose a couple weeks later. But after I try this little thing I realize that this is indeed a very good camera. This camera features a big screen, few buttons, good zoom, nice design, and is simple to operate. About the picture quality I can say that is not top of the line but for the money you pay is really good. This will be great for kids or forgetful people like my girl.

Reviews.Title: Terrific Point and Shoot
Reviews.Author: G. Ware Cornell Jr. "anotherlawyer"
Reviews.Content: My great joy these days is my Nikon D80 10.2MP Digital SLR Camera Kit with 18-55mm f/3.5-5.6G AF-S DX VR & 55-200mm f/4-5.6G ED IF AF-S DX VR Nikkor Zoom Lenses. So what do I need with a point and shoot?The answer is I don't. If I need a quick pic of something, there is always the camera in my iPhone 3G. But I recently got a chance to set up this little Nikon for my stepson and review his work. It was very impressive. The images were clear, focused, and sharp. The camera itself is about the same size but much thinner than a pack of smokes. This makes it easy to carry around in a shirt pocket when those photo moments arise. Given the consistently excellent results, what's not to like.Well what you get in miniaturization you give up in control. While most (and maybe all) DSLRs have electronic controls, they are loaded with manual overrides allowing the photographer to take control quickly. Going through menus whose common features are tiny icons is cumbersome. A 3X optical zoom is nice, but it offers no optical zoom for those who use them. Anti-shake technology is built in using Nikon's VR system found in its best cameras and lenses.I installed a 4GB SD card which stores far more than the camera can hold between charges. A one GB would be more than adequate but my stepson was going to Scotland for three weeks and wouldn't be taking his laptop. I wanted him to have the capacity to take lots of pictures, and he did, but came no where close to the 4GB card's potential.As to charging, we did have a bit of confusion about European voltage. After a bit of research on Nikon's web site I learned that voltage regulation is built into their chargers.This is not a professional camera. But it is a good camera that has my stepson enthusiastic about photography. Since attitude is aptitude, I may be hearing about DSLs from him soon enough.

Reviews.Title: Nice little digital camera
Reviews.Author: Oscar Robledo "orobledo"
Reviews.Content: It's a handy small digital camera. Impressed with it capacity in dark places. Some times, not easy to handle because it small size. The battery don't last so much so another, or a third battery, are needed. Nice colors and fine focus. I have a SLR Nikon D80 and this small one is perfect to complement the "big brother"

Reviews.Title: more than a simple image
Reviews.Author: Jean Rojas "Rojas Jean"
Reviews.Content: simply perfectPurchased this camera looking a little more than a simple image, without thinking I got a camera with a balance of basic and simple, with professional features. undoubtedly the best in its category.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Deal!
Reviews.Author: Wags
Reviews.Content: The price was the best, the transaction was handled promptly and the camera works as expected. I would use this store again.

Reviews.Title: Waiting to see...
Reviews.Author: D. Gordon "Slide Slinger"
Reviews.Content: We bought this Nikon for our college age daughter to replace another Nikon. It was purchased through Amazon.com because no local retailer had it in stock after the holidays. We have had 3 Nikon digital cameras, all very good. Two days after purchase, our daughter could not start the camera; a "LENS ERROR" message was all that would display. The camera is in the Nikon shop. The jury is still out in regard to this camera.

Reviews.Title: Easy to use!
Reviews.Author: Mark Evalia
Reviews.Content: Our last digital camera was from 2001, and ran on AA batteries.  What a huge improvement this is with the Lithium Ion power!  Tiny, with great battery life and good indoor picture quality (flash).  I still haven't read the manual, but with vey limited tech-saavy, was able to enjoy it when it arrived during a weekend hosting friends.

Reviews.Title: It came quickly
Reviews.Author: J. Billups "ainaj"
Reviews.Content: I ordered it last minute and arrived when promised even through the holiday season. the camera is a great point and shoot. although you have to be somee what patient beacause the face satbalizinf feature dealys the shot a little.

Reviews.Title: Great buy.
Reviews.Author: Julianne E. Bychowski
Reviews.Content: The camera has completely lived up to my expectations so far. It is easy to use and great quality for the price. Overall, I am very pleased with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: Great product!
Reviews.Author: S. Meredith "blue2000"
Reviews.Content: Nikon Coolpix S210 8MP Digital Camera with 3x Optical Zoom (black)Great camera so far.  I used just a little, but the results are great.  The only problem that I had was to download the pictures to my computer.  The CD instalation was a little complicated. My older camara is much easy. But once I figured out, everything is working perfectly.  I'm looking forward to use this camera a lot.  It is a great option for a small camara.  I own a big camara with lens and become difficult caring everywhere.  This one here I'm keeping in my bag and I'm taking everywhere I go.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Little
Reviews.Author: Robert E. Elliott "DoubleLL"
Reviews.Content: Perfect for the casual user who likes to e-mail photos, but features allow excellent grabs for printing enlargements.

Reviews.Title: Cute, good quality
Reviews.Author: S. Fan
Reviews.Content: The quality of video is terrific and the appearance is cute.However, it can not be recharged without a battery charger.This is a little inconvenient.

Reviews.Title: Well Worth It!
Reviews.Author: Carrie E. Wilson
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera as a Christmas present for my boyfriend. I searched awhile to find one that was great quality for a great price. The size is great if you're looking for a compact camera, it's small and slim. I have the Nikon S550--and I love it, but I probably don't need 10MP so this camera would have been a great alternative option. It takes wonderful pictures. We had trouble using the face detection--getting it to focus on the main subject, but it really didn't make much of a difference. I would definitely recommend this camera!

Reviews.Title: Great camera for great price
Reviews.Author: MariaInes Carrera "Maria-Ines"
Reviews.Content: This is a great little digital camera for an awesome price. Photo quality may not be the most amazing for artistic shots, but for capturing the moment with friends and family, it's perfect. It's super tiny and convenient, the controls are easy to understand, and it's cool looking too! Perfect for a student or anyone who just needs a good digital camera for super cheap.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera!
Reviews.Author: Barry Hoerz
Reviews.Content: This was purchased to provide quick snap-shots for art projects and miscellaneous items.  I wanted something small, yet with a larger mega-pixel capability.  It fits in your pocket easily, starts up quickly, takes great pictures, and has been very dependable.  Much better than a previous Olympus that got dropped in the water...  Very affordable too!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Angela Hagfeldt
Reviews.Content: I love this camera.  It works like a charm and the picture quality is excellent.  I would highly reccomend it!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Keith "Huge Ron Bennington fan. Pepper Hick s...
Reviews.Content: Great product, The tab on the box cracked like new, and it was! Very satisfied.

Reviews.Title: Great Deal
Reviews.Author: EL
Reviews.Content: Great deal - saved over lowest advertised price I saw anywhere, plus free shipping and no tax!  Product was delivered as promised and very timely.  thanks!

Reviews.Title: nikon s210
Reviews.Author: George J. Rivers "BUGMANN"
Reviews.Content: camera works very easily and was shipped in time for the holidays.the camera is easy to operate and understand. the delete feature is quick without having to go thru menu screens like my olympus camera

Reviews.Title: Great little point and shoot
Reviews.Author: VAB78 "VAB78"
Reviews.Content: I just received this little camera a few days ago. It is so small that it really does fit in my pocket! I love the color and size. I have a 'big' canon powershot that is not always practical to carry, especially just going out with friends, but sometimes you just want to get some snapshots while you are out, and this camera is GREAT for that. I have taken over 100 pictures just playing with the different settings, and have found that most of the time AUTO is the perfect setting, but I have used some of the scene settings and those are good in the right situation...especially the Party setting. The image quality is great on most pictures. The ones that I use the zoom on I have some issues with stability or pictures come out grainy, but I think for most circumstances I just want to use this little camera in situations where zoom will not be that important to me. Afterall that's what I have my canon for! Overall I love this camera and think it takes great pictures for a < $150 digital camera, and can carry it everywhere!Oh, yeah...and mine from JR's came with a free leather carry case by Nikon. I don't know if that is standard or I just got lucky, but it is perfect.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: N. Gravenhorst "Mom"
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera we bought for my daughter's 11th birthday and for my 58 year old mother's Christmas present.  It is simple to use, has lots of fun features (like audio recording and video recording), and takes really nice pictures.  It is a great value, one of the few cameras you can get in this price range with a charger and lithium battery.  In my opinion, it takes just as good of pictures as other cameras that cost double.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix is very cool!
Reviews.Author: Nanny
Reviews.Content: This was a gift for my grandaughter's 10th BD, and she loves it!  She finds it fun, comfortable to handle, and easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: M.B.
Reviews.Content: I love my new camera. It's very small which makes it very nice for carrying around in my purse. I felt it was very easy to use, contrary to other reviews. (Of course with anything, reading the instruction book does help!) This camera takes great pictures inside! MUCH BETTER than my old Kodak Easy Share. The delay in the flash is minimal, again, MUCH BETTER than my old camera. I have been using the camera for over a month now on one battery charge, and that is with the holidays even. I would absolutely recommend this camera to others.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera, Great Service
Reviews.Author: A. N. Boozer
Reviews.Content: I love my new camera! It is very small, takes wonderfully clear pictures, and has a great size screen. It is very easy to use. I am very happy with my purchase!

Reviews.Title: Nikon nice upgrade from my older model
Reviews.Author: Uncle James
Reviews.Content: This model is the best digital camera I have seen under $ 125looks similar to the Casio a family member has only my Nikonhas smaller lcd screen, otherwise, they are almost identical.wonder if Casio makes these for Nikon ?Get one today.  I got Black so it has no reflections from the sunwhen I take photos of people.

Reviews.Title: Great Slim Camera
Reviews.Author: Heather Jones "picture lady"
Reviews.Content: This is a great little camera.  I am generally a fan of the larger cameras with a more professional look.  I bought this camera because I recently had a baby and I needed something that wasn't so big to carry around.  This is a great little camera to slip in the pocket of a diaper bag or in a pants pocket.  The pictures it takes are also very good.  If you are in a dimly lit room however, the flash does creat a shadow on the bottom of your pictures, so be careful with that.  Otherwise this is a great camera that can travel anywhere without being a pain.

Reviews.Title: Great Buy!
Reviews.Author: Cheryl E. Weagraff
Reviews.Content: This was exactly the item I was searching for at a great price.  I gave it as a gift for a young teenager.  She loves it.

Reviews.Title: nikon S210 is AOK
Reviews.Author: D. Schmidt "Random guy"
Reviews.Content: Very good camera for the price.  My 13 year old daughter loves it, which is all that counts.  I actually used it a lot on a recent trip and the shots were all good, day, night, flash, etc.  There is a bit of time between shots, but that's tolerable.

Reviews.Title: simple to use and versatile
Reviews.Author: d.l.
Reviews.Content: easy to use with a variety of setting to best capture a sunset or other scenes.cute unit.would have preferred more optical zoom but could not find in a camera at this price range.thanks nikon

Reviews.Title: Fantastic!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I'm so glad I chose this camera over the other options I had.  The picture quality is amazing, the video quality is amazing and the battery life is amazing.  It's so simple and easy to use and you get wonderful results.  I definitely recommend this camera.  There's not a thing that I don't like about it.

Reviews.Title: I Love It!!
Reviews.Author: Jolierey "YAR"
Reviews.Content: This camera not only looks cool, it's also cool to use.All the icons help me to get what I want and where I need to be to get my perfect shots.The quality of my photos were fantastic!Thank you Coolpix!

Reviews.Title: great little camera
Reviews.Author: chibetsy "tellico betsy"
Reviews.Content: I haven't used my Nikon Coolpix S210 that much yet but what I've found so far is that it's very easy to use.  I'm really looking forward to taking alot of great pictures this summer.

Reviews.Title: great little camera!
Reviews.Author: D. FLOYD
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera for both my daughters and they love it. Nice photos. large view screen.

Reviews.Title: Good product ... good value
Reviews.Author: Hawk-eye
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my daughter ... so far we've both been pleased with the product and it's value. Of course it's Nikon ... I'd not expect less.

Reviews.Title: Terrific & fun little camera!
Reviews.Author: PyrateDan "PyrateDan"
Reviews.Content: I hate taking pictures and I always have to learn any new electronic device that we buy.  This camera was for my wife and she easily understood everything she needed to take some great pictures.  It really is a great little camera.

Reviews.Title: Coolpix is cool!!
Reviews.Author: William E. Hatfield "On the road again..."
Reviews.Content: This is the second Coolpix I have gotten. It is by far, the easiest point and shoot camera I have gotten. And with the 8.0MP, it takes really good quality pics.

Reviews.Title: I didn't get enough time to play! ;0(
Reviews.Author: Chris ""shopped 'til i dropped""
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately I was only able to take about 100 photos before I got a lens error message with this camera.  For as much research as I had done before purchasing a camera, I wasn't expecting to have this happen with a Nikon.  I have owned a Nikon Coolpix 5900 for the last few years and unfortunately it was dropped by accident and met it's demise.  BTW, the 5900 is a GREAT camera for a simple point and shoot.  I have taken a few 1,000 pictures and have enjoyed it every time it's come out of it's case.I never got much time to play with this new camera but I'm giving it 3 stars because I believe that it would have probably been a good camera but not a great camera.  I know that it did so much more than my last camera but for some reason I didn't care for the feel of it.  Nothing specific I can point out though.So I have since returned it to AMAZON and that was the most painless experience I have ever had returning something in my life! Yes I became gun shy to purchse this same Nikon again and instead purchased the Canon SD1100is.  I have only owned it for about 4 days but so far I am loving it.  Hopefully it will stand the test of time!I am still a believer in the Nikon product and have been brand loyal to them for years.  The Canon brand definitely has a level to live up to but I know that 4 days does not a perfect camera make.  I look forward to stretching it's limits.

Reviews.Title: JUST GREAT***
Reviews.Author: O. flamenco "FLAMENCO"
Reviews.Content: I purchase this item for my doughter and she loves it, easy to load pictures to the pc,she is even thinking of adding a tripod for better pics.

Reviews.Title: dude
Reviews.Author: ded fedor
Reviews.Content: I want to add a minus- easy to place batery in wrong way and it gets stuck. Not for older people with bad eyesight

Reviews.Title: Nikon S210
Reviews.Author: Alex D. Bolderoff
Reviews.Content: The camera is great for what i wanted, a cheap, small camera that has decent features. My only complaint would be that I have not seen a way to tell how much battery life is left. The only indication of battery life is a warning symbol that shows up just as the camera runs out of power.

Reviews.Title: read reviews - TERRIBLE reputation for LENS ERRORS w/out cause
Reviews.Author: a reader in DFW
Reviews.Content: Sadly, our recommendation is to -- AVOID THIS CAMERA -- at all costs.** Please see other similar reviews below before purchasing. **LENS ERROR problems ABOUND & render CAMERA UNUSABLE.I so wanted to leave a good review for this camera.  Our family has owned 3 across the last couple of years.  The first 2 cameras of this make/model lasted 14 months, and 8 months, respectively.  Our 3rd died a few months ago after 14 months of use, and prompted me to at last write a review.  LENS ERRORS, without cause (not dropped, no sudden temperature changes, no foreign objects or water got in the camera, batteries were kept appropriately charged, and the like), have rendered all 3 cameras of this make/model unusable.All 3 cameras were used solely by 2 adults with 8 decades of photography experience between us.  Yes, we should have bought a different camera for our 3rd, not purchased another of these, but the size/portability (it is lightweight and a very handy size), and picture quality for the price, were hard to resist.The cameras did take good quality photos (once you read, read, read the manual and practice, practice, practice, practice with the various modes/settings - see other reviews below re this same issue), and have a terrific zoom, but THE LENS FACILITY FUNCTIONS EXTREMELY POORLY.  It stops working suddenly, without explanation or cause, and cannot be repaired for less than 80% of the purchase price for a new one.We CANNOT RECOMMEND this camera for anyone, for any reason, other than perhaps a vacation of just a few days with the understanding your purchase price will be a total loss.

Reviews.Title: Best camera for easy use
Reviews.Author: Cosmic Intergalactic Night Tripper "Neil"
Reviews.Content: This is my third digital camera and this is the best, hands down! It does virtually everything perfectly, e.g. night, backlight, inside and even beautiful video at night to boot. Others who have been with me while vacating were amazed at the quality. One person had an $800 Canon and wasn't able to get the quality in some environments and his camera required a lotta adjustments.If you want something easy to use with great quality pix, you won't regret buying this unit.

Reviews.Title: cool camera for coolpix
Reviews.Author: Allan R. Flamm "ARF738"
Reviews.Content: This is a great little camera. Great photos and my wife carries it in her purse every day. No missed photo ops!

Reviews.Title: nikon
Reviews.Author: K. Ciszek
Reviews.Content: Nikon Coolpix S210 8MP Digital Camera with 3x Optical Zoom (Cool Blue)I loved how easy it was to carry, in my pocket or purse, to take pictures of a road trip with my children. Took mini video clips of them in action and stills of them posing as tourists.

Reviews.Title: nikon camera
Reviews.Author: Christina V. Moyer
Reviews.Content: Great little camera with many features. Comes in many cool colors. Would buy this camera again.

Reviews.Title: Overall Good Buy
Reviews.Author: Sade
Reviews.Content: I love Nikon cameras! So I had to stay in the family whenI upgraded. This small, sleek camera is easy to carry as well as to use. The new features and added megapixels are even more of a plus.

Reviews.Title: Cool camera
Reviews.Author: S. Haver
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for an upcoming vacation.  Its so small (almost the  same size as my cell phone) and fits great in my pocket.  My old camera was bulky and not pocket-friendly.  It starts super fast too, so you won't miss any "kodak moments."  Picture quality seems up to par although I haven't used it that much yet. Fairly simple to use; I spent an hour or so going over the manual.  Altogether a pretty good buy!

Reviews.Title: Poor quality pictures
Reviews.Author: Handy Mark "DIY"
Reviews.Content: This is the second digital camera I have owned and the first in 6 years. Need something a little more compact.I set this up on a tripod to try the different quality settings.I do not notice any difference between any of the 8mp and the 3mp, and none of the pictures is clear at all. Almost like it is slightly out of focus.My gut feeling is that there is something wrong with it, so I is going back tomorrow. and we will try again. I will repost if the replacement is any better.

Reviews.Title: Blurry photos
Reviews.Author: Orphynanni
Reviews.Content: I got this camera 6 months ago and have had mixed results with it.  Electronic VR stabilization or not, the pictures I take turn out blurry about half the time I take them.  That's pretty annoying when you're trying to capture the moment.  I usually have to stand very, very still, prop the camera on a solid surface, or use the flash.  My other complaint is that the photos tend to turn out really washed out if I take outdoor photos.  Even on "vivid" mode the colors in the photos are dull. I usually have to lower the exposure compensation manually before I take a photo.One good thing, I have to say, is the "night landscape" mode works really well if you use a tripod or set the camera up on a flat surface and use the timer.  I've taken some amazing night scenes with it.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: F. Calo "curlyq3367"
Reviews.Content: I have had the camera for about a month now and i love it. Picture quality is great and shutter time is very quick. Great price for the quality!!

Reviews.Title: A little bit disappointed
Reviews.Author: Texas "Jack's Mom"
Reviews.Content: Grainy display, too slow, not many features, pics can't be modified once they are taken....a little too pricey for what you get. And it's not as fast as I'd hoped. I wish I had bought a different camera.

Reviews.Title: NOT happy
Reviews.Author: Sarah Thomsen
Reviews.Content: I paid for 3-5 day shipping and it still took 10 days to get to my door. I used the camera for one weekend and it already says lens error. I got hussled on the shipping and now the camera doesn't even work. Thanks Amazon!

Reviews.Title: OK
Reviews.Author: Stela Carmen C. Otero "stelacramer"
Reviews.Content: The item came with a problem but it was successfully replaced and it didn't take too long, so I'm satisfied.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: V. Bullock
Reviews.Content: This product is good i love the features it has and i can't wait to use it for my vegas trip and test out all scene options. No Problems yet..

Reviews.Title: I love this camara!!
Reviews.Author: K. Hincher "Khincher"
Reviews.Content: I love my new Nikon Camara...it takes great pictures, its small so it fits anywhere & its easy to carry around, its stylish, I love it, I am very satisfied with this produt!

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: jazzyjules "jazzyjules"
Reviews.Content: This is a great little camera.  I am a novice when it comes to digital cameras and bought a Pentax Optio M20 a couple years ago.  With that camera I am thinking that digital cameras were supposed to take good pictures-the Pentax is 7 MP-but I was not getting good pictures.  Plus it was very difficult to use.  But this Nikon is very easy to use and takes great pictures.  I take the same picture with both cameras and the Nikon wins hands down.

Reviews.Title: junk
Reviews.Author: M. Izbicki
Reviews.Content: 3 weeks old and the lens jammed. "customer support claimed misuse. I have contacted support several times but no replies

Reviews.Title: nice camera
Reviews.Author: Savita Kishore
Reviews.Content: very nice camera but i haven't used that one still i bought it for giving a gift to my family

Reviews.Title: Decent Camera- If you only shoot stills
Reviews.Author: B. Williams ""We must be the change we wi...
Reviews.Content: I received my Coolpix L18 as a birthday gift.  For photos, I'd give it only 2 stars.  For video, considering what the camera is (a portable webcam), I'd give it 4 stars... Hence the 3 star rating.For a camera primarily designed for still pictures, the Coolpix camera does a decent job with video.  If you're a video blogger, or just want something small that can fit in your pocket, then the Coolpix camera might be for you.HOWEVER, if you're taking photos of anything other than stationary objects, you will find this camera to be quite frustrating.  There is a shutter lag of nearly two seconds, which is plenty of time for a moving object to leave the field of the viewfinder or change to an undesirable position.  I had hoped that disabling the flash (to get rid of the pre-flash) would eliminate this problem, and while there is a slight decrease in the delay, it's not enough to make a big difference.In addition, there are problems with the auto-focus.  It has some nice functions for focusing on faces, but if you like to take close-ups (as I do with my nature photography... with flowers and butterflies), you can expect your subject to be completely fuzzy and out of focus.  This is also a problem in low-light conditions with photos that aren't close-up.Sure, this camera can take some decent pictures, but if you want to take pictures at sporting events, animals, low light conditions and close-ups, DON'T GET THIS CAMERA!!!  You will only develop a lot of frustration.

Reviews.Title: It's a Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Shauna Stott
Reviews.Content: What more can I say.  It was a birthday present for my thirteenth birthday, hence I am over 13.I love my camera.  It is beautiful, functional, and colorful, just like Kate Moss.Michelle

Reviews.Title: Slick little digital camera!
Reviews.Author: D. Lee
Reviews.Content: This compact, stylish digital camera packs a punch in technology and features not expected in such an affordable option, particularly from a name brand like Nikon.  Bravo... terrific value.

Reviews.Title: JUST GREAT!!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: m.c.
Reviews.Content: ITS REALLY LIGHT TAKES GREAT PICTURES HAS GREAT FEATURES YOU SHOULD BUY THIS BETTER THEN ANY CAMERA I SEEN IN MY LIFE!!!!!!!!!!!

ProductInfo.Features:
8.1-megapixel resolution for stunning prints as large as 16 x 20 inches
3x optical zoom; Electronic VR image stabilization
2.5-inch, high-resolution LCD
In-Camera Red-Eye Fix; enhanced Face-Priority AF automatically focuses on up to 12 faces
Capture images to SD memory card (not included)
ProductInfo.Name: Nikon Coolpix S210 8MP Digital Camera with 3x Optical Zoom (Plum)
